title: Revealing the Beano's plan to turn Dennis the Menace woke – and to emulate Marvel
text:
He’s a force for good,” says Beano Studios chief executive Emma Scott of her star performer, Dennis the Menace.

“He’s a decent human being but he just wants to have a good time,” she adds. “I think he’s a great poster child for what this generation stands for.”

Dennis, two years shy of his 70th birthday, is being rebranded. He is, according to Scott, no longer merely a hero for naughty boys and girls, but also a figure at home in the more earnest world of Greta Thunberg.

The young climate campaigner may be demanding a radical overhaul of capitalism, but she is also being used by marketeers as the herald of “Generation Alpha”, an even younger cohort of potential consumers.

Pre-teen childhood is...
description: He’s a force for good,” says Beano Studios chief executive Emma Scott of her star performer, Dennis the Menace.
